text: in this problem we have 10 moles of
water in a beaker we need to find the
number of moles of sodium chloride that
we need to add to our 10 moles of water
to create a five percent biomass
solution
of sodium chloride
the first step is to find the molecular
weight of water
and this can be done by adding the
atomic weight of oxygen plus two times
the atomic weight of H because we have a
subscript of two so two times one grams
per mole plus 60 grams per mole gives us
18 grams per mole of water now we can
use this molecular mass we could
multiply that by 10 moles to get the
amount in grams of water in our solution
so 18 times 10 gives us 180 the moles
cancel we're left with grams so 180
grams of water in our beaker
now we know we want to create a five
percent bi-mass solution of sodium
chloride so we use the formula five
percent is equal to the number of sodium
chloride we need to add in terms of
grams divided by the total number of
grams so 180 grams of water that we
already have
plus the X the x is the number of sodium
chloride in grams that we need to add
multiply the whole thing by 100. this is
simply the formula for mass percentage
next we do a little algebra
we bring the 100 over so we divide 5 by
100 to get 0.05
then we bring the bottom over multiply
this whole bottom by 0.05 so we get 0.05
times 180 plus X
when we multiply this out we get 9 plus
we equate that
to X because the X was left on the other
side
and now we simply solve for x and we get
9 equals
we divide by 0.95 X and we get
9.47 grams of sodium chloride that we
need to add to the solution of 10 moles
to get it five percent by mass solution
of sodium chloride the final step is to
find the number of moles of sodium
chloride so we have the number of grams
we need to add but our question tell
asks us to find the number of moles
to find that we need to find the
molecular weight of sodium chloride to
find the molecular weight of sodium
chloride we simply add the atomic
weights of sodium and chloride so 23
grams per mole plus 35.5 grams per mole
gives us 58.5 grams per mole this is the
molecular weight of sodium chloride
now to find the number of moles
we divide our molecular weight or we
divide our amount that we have by our
molecular weight
the grams cancel the moles go on top so
9.47 divided by 58.5 gives us
0.16 moles of sodium chloride that we
need to add to our solution to create
a five percent by mass solution of
sodium chloride
